SVGImageElement.summary: The SVGImageElement interface corresponds to the image element.

SVGImageElementWidth.summary:
The width read-only property of the
interface returns an
corresponding to the {{SVGAttr("width")}} attribute of the given image
element.

SVGImageElementX.summary:
The x read-only property of the
interface returns an
corresponding to the {{SVGAttr("x")}} attribute of the given image
element.

SVGImageElementHref.summary: The href read-only property of the interface reflects the {{SVGAttr("href")}} or {{SVGAttr("xlink:href")}} {{deprecated_inline}} attribute of the given {{SVGElement("image")}} element.

SVGImageElementHeight.summary:
The height read-only property of the
interface returns an
corresponding to the height attribute of the given
image element.

SVGImageElementDecoding.summary: The decoding property of the interface provides a hint to the browser as to whether it should perform image decoding synchronously or asynchronously.
SVGImageElementDecoding.value: A string representing the decoding hint. Possible values are:

SVGImageElementPreserveAspectRatio.summary:
The preserveAspectRatio read-only
property of the interface returns an
corresponding to the
{{SVGAttr("preserveAspectRatio")}} attribute of the given image
element.

SVGImageElementCrossOrigin.summary: The crossOrigin property of the interface is a string which specifies the Cross-Origin Resource Sharing ({{Glossary("CORS")}}) setting to use when retrieving the image. It reflects the {{SVGAttr("crossorigin")}} content attribute of the given {{SVGElement("image")}} element.
SVGImageElementCrossOrigin.value: A string which specifies the CORS mode used when fetching the image resource. Valid values are "anonymous" or "use-credentials". If the crossOrigin property is set to any other value, it is the same as specifying "anonymous".

SVGImageElementDecode.summary:
The decode() method of the
interface initiates asynchronous decoding of an image,
returning a that resolves once the image is decoded and it is safe to append
it to the DOM.

remarks.para:
-: The same thing, but for HTML <img> elements
-What does the image decoding attribute actually do? on tunetheweb.com (2023)

SVGImageElementDecode.returns: A that fulfills with undefined once the image data is ready to be used, for example by appending it to the DOM, replacing an existing image, and so forth.

SVGImageElementY.summary:
The y read-only property of the
interface returns an
corresponding to the {{SVGAttr("y")}} attribute of the given image
element.
